Entries.default: Clouds gather in the distance, a hazy curtain of rain hanging from them.

The clouds darken in the distance, piling one atop the next as if in a battle for superiority. A vision-searing thread of lightning forks between sea and sky, followed almost immediately by a rib-rattling crash of thunder.
With no crew to man the rigging and rudder, you're entirely at Ondra's mercy...
[Specified 0] peers at the storm. "Nothing more than a squall, captain. It shouldn't be much of a threat to sail through."
[Specified 0] eyes the storm and spits. "I wish this ship had a boatswain - there's no one better to have with you in a storm."
Your crew looks to you. "Your orders?"
With no crew to man the rigging and rudder, you're entirely at Ondra's mercy...
[Specified 0] eyes the storm and spits. "I wish this ship had a boatswain - there's no one better to have with you in a storm."

[Specified 0] swallows. "Gods alive, captain, did you offend Ondra herself? If that's not a manifestation of her fury, I don't know what is." The boatswain casts an eye across the deck. 

"We shouldn't try to wait out a storm like that - a big wave is too likely to roll the whole damn ship and drown us all. Our best hope is to outrun it."
[Specified 0] frowns at the growing storm. "This is no squall, captain - it's a tempest. Don't let the waves hit the ship from the side, and close the hatches. We can try to ride it out if we must."
[Assign crew duties.]
[Ask a companion's aid.]
"We're as prepared as we're going to get. Take us in."
"Maia, can you and Ishiza help us scout the extent of this storm?"
You seek out one of your fellow travelers.
The crew look to you for guidance.
"Take this rope, Tekēhu, and secure yourself to the mast. Don't want you going overboard while you use your abilities on this storm."
"The crew could use a sermon, Xoti, if you're inclined to give them comfort."

"You know what to do, stinkfeathers." 

Maia launches the bird off her arm. Ishiza spreads his wings and lets the winds carry him higher until he's a distant, red-blue speck. 

Shielding her eyes, Maia watches his flight patterns carefully.

"Of course, captain." 

Tekēhu ties himself off by the waist, giving enough slack to adjust his posture as he begins a fluid, intricate form. 

The waves around you respond to him at once.
"You want me to pray to an aspect of death?" Xoti's lips quirk in amusement.
"All hands, get belowdecks and <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_SecureCargo">secure the cargo</link>!"
"Everyone into the rigging! We need to <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_Reefing_Sails">reef the sails</link>!"
"<link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_RainBarrels">Bring the rain barrels</link> up from the hold. Let's see if we can't get some water out of this."
"[Specified 1], take this line and lash yourself to the wheel. I don't want you going overboard."
"Hand out the last of the cooked food, [Specified 3], and then put out any fires in the galley."
[Assign deckhand duties.]
"Get everyone belowdecks and batten the hatches! We're <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_LieAhull">lying ahull</link>!"
"All hands to their posts! We're <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_HoldCourse">holding course</link>!"

The clouds sweep over you, dominating the sky and hemming the sea beneath a roiling gray dome. The rain drums against the deck.

Sweat beads on [Specified 1]'s brow as the storm looms ever closer. "We can't outrun this one, captain!"
You consider how best to use your hands...
With a grimace, [Specified 1] accepts the rope and begins looping it through the spokes of the wheel... and his own belt.
[Specified 3] salutes. "Understood, captain. The crew will be glad to have a warm meal before we dive into this mess."
With a chorus of affirmatives, the crew disappears belowdecks.
The crew ascend into the rigging, pulling lines and tying off the sails, diminishing the amount of fabric facing the wind, before returning to the deck.
The hands drag up empty barrels from the hold and begin securing them along the rails.
The sea roils and the ship rocks as waves broadside [Player Ship]. The wind drives rain across the decks.
The wind calms, but rain pours from the sky as if [Player Ship] had come to rest beneath a waterfall. Rainwater sloshes across the deck and under the rails.

The cry rises like a pronouncement of doom from belowdecks:

"Fire!"

You dive into the hold to see flames licking the beams and making towards the stores... and the powder reserves.

The ship rocks interminably and unpredictably, and soon the crew clutch their heads or guts, bent double over buckets squeezed tight between their knees. 

The befouled grog scent of their sick thickens the air.
"We're <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_Heave_To">heaving-to!</link> Lash the rudder against the sails and get belowdecks!"
"We're <link="glossary://GlossaryEntry_Action_BarePoles">flying bare poles</link>, [Specified 1]! Everyone else get below!"
The sea roils and the ship rocks as waves broadside [Player Ship]. The wind drives rain across the decks.
The wind calms, but rain pours from the sky as if [Player Ship] had come to rest beneath a waterfall. Rainwater sloshes across the deck and under the rails.
Water sloshes about the hold, already knee-deep. [Player Ship] is taking on water.

With a sickening lurch, the ship rolls sideways... and doesn't right itself. You scramble for purchase as brutal waves overcome the railing and ceaseless rain pounds on you from above.

A missed grab plunges you into the sea.

Your lungs burn, desperate for air, but you find none. Darkness takes you.
"Pump the bilges and use the water to get those flames under control!"
"Take the water from the stores and put out that fire!"
[Douse the fire with water magic.]
The wave of magical water crashes across the fire, dousing it utterly and filling the hold with fetid steam.
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
After hours of fighting, the crew finally extinguishes the fire. [Specified 4]'s burns, however, are too extensive, and the mariner expires later that evening.
Hours later, the crew, sweaty and soot-stained, clap one another on the back - no trace of fire remains.
Hours later, the crew, sweaty and soot-stained, clap one another on the back - no trace of fire remains.

The flames spread through the stores before pouring out onto the deck. You'd think nothing dry enough to burn in this storm, but the rigging and sails reluctantly catch, smoldering.

The fire spreads across [Player Ship], raging out of your control.

The vessel is lost with all hands.

As if exhausted, the clouds finally calm, coming to rest like a thick blanket across the sky. The waves, too, end their trembling complaint, and [Player Ship] finally sails easily.

The crew lean against the rails and rigging, their faces haggard but relieved.

The storm, it seems, has passed.
"Open the gun ports. The crew will feel better if they can see the horizon."
"[Specified 0], I want you to work your magic with whatever medicine we have."
"Get everyone up on deck. Fresh air should help."
[Psychically reduce their nausea.]
Your mind reaches for the thoughts of the crew, turning them from the ship's sway. They blink as the sickness lifts from them like an unpleasant dream.
Eyes closed, [Specified 5] concentrates on the crew. Soon mariners take to their feet again, the sickness no longer weighing on them.
The crew grumble as they climb up into the rain and wind, but they stop vomiting for the moment.

[Specified 0] nods. "Very well. I know just the thing."

The surgeon moves among the crew, providing relief to the afflicted.
The crew open the gun ports, moving to them both for a view of the sea and to be rid of the contents of their buckets.
The crew scurry about the deck as they make to hunker down belowdecks.
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
Waves rise and break over the rails, sending water cascading across the decks. Sailors shout orders to one another, clinging to the rigging for their lives as you cut your way through the storm.
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
[Specified 0] shouts orders to the hands as you knot the ropes around the ship's wheel. When the ship is set to sail as best it can without a guiding hand, you join the others belowdecks.
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
[Specified 1] grimly grips the wheel as the rest of the crew secure the furled sails and disappear belowdecks.
The wind presses hard against the masts, driving [Player Ship] forward, and the vessel plows through the storm.

Propelled by the wind against its stern and masts, [Player Ship] bounds roughly across the waves. 

In the darkness belowdecks, the crew jostles with the cargo - kith and crate alike thrown heavily about.
The crew hunker belowdecks, sealing every hatch against the deluge.
Hats and cloaks turned against the rain, the crew guide [Player Ship] through the unending downpour.
The sea runs thick across the decks, pouring in through the hatches and ports alike.

"Hands to the pumps! Get that water out of there!"
"We need to lose weight! Throw everything we don't need overboard!"
"Forget the water - fix the damned leaks!"
[Freeze the encroaching water.]
The frigid magic sweeps across the encroaching water, freezing it solid and plugging whatever gaps it seeped in from... for the moment.
The crew move quickly along the hull, expertly patching breaks and plugging holes.
Despite their best efforts, the crew make little headway, as dropped tools and sodden supplies hamper their labor.
The crew haul supplies and ammunition to the deck, heaving the heaviest ballast into the sea to lighten the ship.
The crew work in shifts, pumping water out a little faster than it comes in.
The hands pump the water out, keeping pace with the water coming in. By the end of the day, [Specified 2] is soaked entirely through and cradling an arm.
A cacophonous crack echoes across the deck, announcing the failure of the mast. It swings down, still wrapped in the rigging, and crashes into the portside hull like a battering ram.
A wild current charges the air as the rainwater twists and reshapes itself unnaturally. Before your eyes, blights manifest from the ambient essence, swarming across your deck.
The storm sets the sea to churning, bending masts, twisting lines, and tumbling enormous waves across the deck. The wind drives the rain at an angle so sharp as to be almost sideways.

Somewhere something cracks.
A wave crashes over the deck, sweeping a screaming [Specified 1] from the wheel and into the sea.
"Kith overboard! Grab a line and mount a rescue!"
"Ondra, please watch over this mariner's soul, consigned to your cold embrace."
[Summon tentacles to rescue [Specified 4].]
"Xoti, please guide [Specified 4]'s soul to Gaun."

Line tied around the waist, [Specified 2] leaps over the rail and vanishes into the water.

A few minutes later, the deckhand reappears, a sputtering [Specified 1] held close.

You help pull the sailors back onto the deck.

[Specified 2] grabs the line and dives over the rail.

You weather the storm for several long minutes waiting for some sign of the sailors. When you pull the ruined rope in, it comes without resistance.

Both [Specified 2] and [Specified 4] are lost.
You catch no further sight of the lost sailor.
You chant, calling through the essence into the dark depths of the arcane.
As [Specified 5] chants, a sickly, salty scent fills the air.
A long, writhing tentacle rises from the riotous depths. It deposits the lost sailor - who promptly vomits - back on the tilting deck.
The tentacles search the churning water, but none grasp hold of the missing mariner.
The Dawnstar nods and raises her lantern against the gale, reaping the spirit of the lost.
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
"That's enough for now."
You turn from the crew.
Serafen balks. "You gone fathom-addled, cap? Waves like this, you be more like to sink than save us!"
"You heard me."
The storm rages on, showing no sign of subsiding...
The surgeon frowns. "I'd love to, captain, but [Player Ship] doesn't have enough in storage to make a difference."

The clouds roil above you, the seas boil below, and everything between disappears into a velvet deluge of rain.

[Specified 0] grips the rigging, shouting, "Gods alive, captain! Ondra's in a fury!" 

The deck bucks beneath your feet as the tempest tosses [Player Ship].

Water rises in the distance, a gargantuan swell that bends the sea around it. It bears down on you...

"Gods alive..." a hand mutters.
Serafen shouts over the roar of the storm. "That big hunk of hardwood'll be putting a hole right through our broadside if we don't be cutting it free!"
"Leave it! We can't risk getting in the rigging!"
Again and again the mast pounds against the side of the ship, each time with the force of an enraged ogre. The ship groans beneath the onslaught.
"Get up on deck and cut that mast free before it punches through the hull!"
Hatchet in hand, Serafen helps cut the lines, sending the mast plunging into the roiling deep.
The hands climb in the rigging, hacking at the lines until the mast finally slides free and slips beneath the waves.
The hands climb in the rigging, hacking at the lines until the mast finally slides free and slips beneath the waves.
The ship pitches suddenly, and a monstrous wave strikes it directly across the deck. With a despairing scream, [Specified 4] sweeps over the rail.

"Get belowdecks and seal the hatches!"
[Attack] "To arms! We have to defend the ship!"
The rain spatters your face and soaks your clothes as you face off against the advancing entities of raging energy...

As you huddle belowdecks, you can hear the blights raging above. It almost sounds like screaming. Electricity cracks and pops along the inside of the hull, leaving forking, blackened paths, and water seeps around the edges of the hatches.

Then, as quickly as it brought them, the storm sweeps the entities away.
When you return to the deck, you find [Specified 1]'s lifeless body still lashed tightly to the wheel.

[Specified 0] shouts the dreaded warning: "The powder's about to go!" The crew leap for safety, taking cover wherever they find it. 

With the wrath of Magran herself, the powder barrel blows, blasting gaping holes through the decks above and below.

"You heard me."

You turn the ship from the wave, intending to stay perpendicular to it. It rises to port, and the deck lists sickeningly to starboard. 

You cling desperately to the wheel as the wave crashes down upon you, searing your skin and trying to prying at your aching fingers.
Bracing yourself at the bow, you stare into the rising wall of water as you chant, calling on the essence around you and giving it form.
Braced against the bow, [Specified 5] chants, arms upraised, shimmering with the spell's building power.

The spell rages outward, shaking the deck and shearing away the forward rigging. It tears into the front of the wave, plowing a liquid chasm through the swell. As [Player Ship] sails through, the water flows in behind it in a thunderous roar.

[Specified 1] points the bowsprit directly into the wave. The deck rises before you, water rushing past to either side as the ship ascends. You experience a moment of weightlessness before [Player Ship] pitches forward and plunges down the far side of the wave.

The helmsman howls - though you're not sure whether in excitement or terror.

The deck pitches madly towards the sky as you ascend, and your stomach lurches as [Player Ship] vaults from the wave's crest, crashing hard down the backside of the swell.

Crew cry out as they cling desperately to the rigging, and the ship groans in complaint.

With a white-knuckled grip on the wheel, [Specified 1] strains against the rudder, carefully guiding [Player Ship] across the massive swell's flank.

The helmsman lets out a cry of victory as you descend from the crest.

Despite the crew's efforts, the wave continues to rise to one side of the ship even as it vanishes from the other. The deck's angle moves ever nearer vertical...

Whether the ship breaks through the wave or the wave breaks over it, the result is the same - thousands of gallons of water slamming across the hull with wood-rending force.

Ishiza lands on Maia's arm and pecks her cheek affectionately.

"Suppose I can plead for the safe passage of our souls through Hel, should we all perish shortly."

After a nod, she bows her head.
"Glory be to the many aspects of Eothas, greatest of all who is Gaun. I raise my voice to you in humility, thankfulness, and everlasting worship. Hear me, my god, and take pity on my dire plea."

"As we now sail through the dark storms of death, we will not fear the reaping to come. For your lantern will guide our way. We will not stumble or stray from the path you have laid us through Hel. We will embrace the end of our lives and shuck the rotting husk of our fallen bodies."

"After whence, we will be planted for rebirth by your hand.

"Forever and always, as the Wheel turns,

"Amen."
[Raise Lord Darryn's Voulge towards the sky.] "Take us into the storm."

The crew look to one another before setting to the task. [Player Ship]'s bow turns into the storm, sliding into the rain as if passing through a veil. The ship comes to troubled rest under the tormented skies.

Lightning stabs across the clouds.
The lightning strikes the weapon, running through it and into you. Sparks fly from your limbs as the whole of the world goes white around you and blooms of violet burst behind your eyes.

You climb into the rigging, grasping tightly to the lines with one hand while thrusting the voulge skyward with the other. The blinding blue-violet arcs seem only feet away.

As [Player Ship] crests a swell, it pushes you towards the raging elements above, and they deign to meet you, a ragged fork of energy falling from the clouds like a headsman's axe.

When your sight returns, the sea is calm. The clouds form a smooth gray blanket above. The voulge feels heavier, as if the weight of the storm resides within.

You descend from the rigging to the cheers and clapping of the crew.
